---
title: "05 - Numeric predictors"
author: "Stefano Coretta"
format:
  mono-light-revealjs:
    theme: [default, custom.scss]
    history: false
filters:
  - tachyonsextra
---




## Set order of levels


::: {.cell}

:::



## Vowel duration by speech rate


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](05_numeric_files/figure-revealjs/vdur-speech-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


## Numeric predictors

$$
\begin{align}
vdur_i & \sim LogNormal(\mu_i, \sigma)\\
\mu_i & = \beta_{1,voicing[i], language[i]} + \beta_2 \cdot \text{spr}\\
\beta_{1jw} & \sim Gaussian(\mu_j, \sigma_j) & , \text{for } j = 1..2\\
 &  &  w = 1..2\\
\beta_2 & \sim Gaussian(\mu_3, \sigma_3)\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_4)\\
\end{align}
$$

## Get default priors: indexing


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                prior class                                  coef group resp
               (flat)     b                                                 
               (flat)     b    c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian           
               (flat)     b     c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish           
               (flat)     b c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian           
               (flat)     b  c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish           
               (flat)     b                         speech_rate_c           
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5) sigma                                                 
 dpar nlpar lb ub       source
                       default
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
             0         default
```


:::
:::


## Priors


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
              prior class                                  coef group resp dpar
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b    c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian                
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b     c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish                
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian                
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b  c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish                
     normal(0, 0.5)     b                         speech_rate_c                
     normal(0, 0.1) sigma                                                      
 nlpar   lb   ub source
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
```


:::
:::

## Fit the model


::: {.cell}

:::


## Model summary


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 Family: lognormal 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = identity 
Formula: v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation:language + speech_rate_c 
   Data: token_measures (Number of observations: 1342) 
  Draws: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup draws = 4000

Regression Coefficients:
                                      Estimate Est.Error l-80% CI u-80% CI Rhat
speech_rate_c                            -0.19      0.01    -0.20    -0.18 1.00
c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian     4.64      0.01     4.63     4.66 1.00
c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian        4.75      0.01     4.74     4.77 1.00
c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish      4.35      0.02     4.33     4.37 1.00
c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish         4.44      0.01     4.42     4.46 1.00
                                      Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
speech_rate_c                             6068     3582
c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian     6112     3110
c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian        6022     3294
c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish      5909     2482
c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish         5415     3012

Further Distributional Parameters:
      Estimate Est.Error l-80% CI u-80% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
sigma     0.23      0.00     0.22     0.24 1.00     5878     3114

Draws were sampled using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
```


:::
:::

## Posterior probability distribution: difference of vowel duration


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

         Term                       Contrast language Estimate 10.0 % 90.0 %
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) - mean(voiceless)  Italian    12.74  10.49  14.99
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) - mean(voiceless)  Polish      6.93   4.84   9.11

Columns: term, contrast, language, estimate, conf.low, conf.high, predicted_lo, predicted_hi, predicted, tmp_idx 
Type:  response 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

         Term                       Contrast language Estimate 10.0 % 90.0 %
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) / mean(voiceless)  Italian     1.12   1.09   1.14
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) / mean(voiceless)  Polish      1.09   1.06   1.12

Columns: term, contrast, language, estimate, conf.low, conf.high, predicted_lo, predicted_hi, predicted, tmp_idx 
Type:  response 
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

  Term Estimate  10.0 % 90.0 %
 b2=b1  -0.0242 -0.0601  0.013

Columns: term, estimate, conf.low, conf.high 
Type:  response 
```

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
